DOC.brief_summary: Language barrier continue impede access quality care limit English proficient population . Recent research demonstrate access language concordant provider increase quality care . This project evaluate efficacy acceptability model intervention improve second language proficiency , patient-centered communication , clinical competency nurse practitioner student care Spanish-speaking patient diabetes .
DOC.brief_title: Integrated Second Language Learning Chronic Care
DOC.detailed_description: The purpose randomize control 2-group study test effect innovative educational intervention call Integrated Language Learning Chronic Care ( IL2L ) successful self-management diabetes . It pursue integrate development second language interpersonal communication skill facilitate productive interaction Spanish-speaking nurse practitioner ( NP ) limit English proficiency Hispanic patient diabetes . The intervention target acquisition language skill facilitate communicative function know effective engage chronically ill patient . It accelerate acquisition skill add longitudinal clinical instruction dimension . Further , investigator propose efficacy intervention demonstrate provider level improve linguistic interpersonal performance patient level improve diabetes outcome response language concordance . In support claim , investigator seek achieve follow specific aim : Aim 1 : To determine efficacy IL2L Chronic Care intervention physical mental health outcome Spanish-speaking patient diabetes . Our hypothesis : H1 : Patients IL2L care group report well physical health ( HbA1C , lipid , weight ) , mental health ( depression anxiety ) satisfaction healthcare patient non-IL2L care group . Aim 2 : To determine efficacy IL2L Chronic Care intervention provider language proficiency interpersonal communication skill . Our hypothesis : H2 : Providers expose IL2L intervention demonstrate improve Spanish language skill interpersonal communication skill upon completion intervention.Specific Aim 3 : To assess acceptability IL2L Chronic Care model within graduate level nurse practitioner curriculum lead College Nursing . The study employ mixed-methods model ass efficacy accessibility IL2L Chronic Care educational intervention The Ohio State University 's College Nursing nurse practitioner program . To achieve Aim 1 , investigator use randomize control trial demonstrate efficacy IL2L Chronic Care model patient level . The investigator compare group patient expose provider underwent IL2L intervention ( intervention group ) group patient undergo standard care ( comparison group ) . To achieve Aim 2 , investigator use qualitative data interaction analysis system demonstrate improvement Spanish language proficiency interpersonal communication skill . To achieve Aim 3 , investigator use combination quantitative qualitative measure within RE-AIM model ass acceptability IL2L chronic care model program level nurse practitioner program lead College Nursing . The study approve institutional review board university prior implementation patient student provider provide write informed consent .
